IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE PURPOSE OF DURHAM ACADEMY IS TO PROVIDE EACH STUDENT AN EDUCATION THAT WILL ENABLE HIM OR HER TO LIVE A MORAL, HAPPY AND PRODUCTIVE LIFE. THE DEVELOPMENT OF INTELLECT IS CENTRAL TO SUCH A LIFE AND, THUS, INTELLECTUAL ENDEAVOR AND GROWTH ARE THE PRIMARY WORK OF THE SCHOOL. THE ACQUISITION OF KNOWLEDGE; THE DEVELOPMENT OF SKILLS, CRITICAL JUDGMENT AND INTELLECTUAL CURIOSITY; AND INCREASED UNDERSTANDING ARE THE GOALS OF THE SCHOOL'S ACADEMIC PROGRAM.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE PURPOSE OF DURHAM ACADEMY IS TO PROVIDE EACH STUDENT AN EDUCATION THAT WILL ENABLE HIM OR HER TO LIVE A MORAL, HAPPY AND PRODUCTIVE LIFE. THE DEVELOPMENT OF INTELLECT IS CENTRAL TO SUCH A LIFE AND, THUS, INTELLECTUAL ENDEAVOR AND GROWTH ARE THE PRIMARY WORK OF THE SCHOOL. THE ACQUISITION OF KNOWLEDGE; THE DEVELOPMENT OF SKILLS, CRITICAL JUDGMENT AND INTELLECTUAL CURIOSITY; AND INCREASED UNDERSTANDING ARE THE GOALS OF THE SCHOOL'S ACADEMIC PROGRAM.
IRS990.Desc: DURHAM ACADEMY PROVIDES SCHOOLING FOR PRE-SCHOOL THROUGH TWELFTH GRADE STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS AN INVESTMENT TOOL TO HOLD FUNDS TO BE USED TOWARDS THE SCHOOLS PROGRAMS.

ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA REQUIRE MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE ACADEMY AND RECOGNIZE A TAX LIABILITY (OR ASSET) IF THE ACADEMY HAS TAKEN AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION THAT MORE LIKELY THAN NOT WOULD BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE APPLICABLE AUTHORITIES. MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE ACADEMY, AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2018, THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY (OR ASSET) OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ACADEMY IS SUBJECT TO ROUTINE AUDITS BY TAXING JURISDICTIONS; HOWEVER THERE ARE CURRENTLY NO AUDITS FOR ANY TAX PERIODS IN PROGRESS.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 32,239. COST OF GOODS SOLD 119,249. SUMMER PROGRAMS 691,507. RENTAL EXPENSE 19,069.
GAIN ON SALE OF FIXED ASSETS 9,758.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 119,249. SUMMER PROGRAMS 691,507. FUNDRAISING EVENT 32,239. RENTAL EXPENSE 19,069.
GAIN ON SALE OF FIXED ASSETS 9,758.
HEAD OF SCHOOL, MICHAEL ULKU-STEINER RECEIVED A HOUSING ALLOWANCE WHICH WAS TAXABLE.
AS PART OF DANIEL GILSON'S COMPENSATION PACKAGE, HE IS TO BE PAID A BONUS EQUAL TO 10% OF DURHAM ACADEMY'S NET PROFIT FROM THE EXTENDED DAY PROGRAM AND SUMMER CAMP.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: TO REFUND A PRIOR ISSUE (2013) AND FUND NEW CAPITAL PROJECTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OF THE $25,570,000 ISSUE PRICE, THE ACADEMY HAS DRAWN $9,740,755, WHICH WAS USED TO REFUND A PRIOR ISSUE. THE REMAINING $15,829,245 IS FOR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: DURHAM ACADEMY PAYS C.T. WILSON CONSTRUCTION FOR CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WILL BE REVIEWED BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, DIRECTOR OF BUSINESS SERVICES AND FINANCE COMMITTEE. THE FINANCE COMMITTEE WILL APPROVE THE DRAFT INCLUDING ANY IDENTIFIED CHANGES AS A RESULT OF THIS REVIEW. THE FINAL FORM 990 TAX RETURN WILL BE SIGNED BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND A COPY OF THE APPROVED RETURN WILL BE PROVIDED TO ALL OF THE OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND TRUSTEES BEFORE THE RETURN IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANY MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES SHALL DISCLOSE TO THE BOARD ANY RELATIONSHIP WHICH HE/SHE MAY HAVE WITH ANY PERSON, CORPORATION OR OTHER ENTITY WITH WHOM THE SCHOOL PROPOSES TO ENTER INTO ANY CONTRACT OR OTHER TRANSACTION WHICH WILL OR MAY RESULT IN FINANCIAL GAIN OR ADVANTAGE TO SUCH BOARD MEMBERS BY REASON OF SUCH RELATIONSHIP. IF IT APPEARS THAT A BOARD MEMBER HAS FAILED TO MAKE DISCLOSURE BEFORE THE SCHOOL ENTERS INTO SUCH CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION, THE BOARD MAY REMOVE SUCH TRUSTEE BY VOTE OF A SIMPLE MAJORITY OF THE TRUSTEES THEN IN OFFICE, AT ANY MEETING IN WHICH A QUORUM IS PRESENT. IF ANY TRUSTEE IS SO REMOVED A NEW TRUSTEE MAY BE ELECTED AT THE SAME MEETING OR AT A SUBSEQUENT MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S HEAD OF SCHOOL INCLUDES ALL OF THESE ELEMENTS: THE REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD, USE OF DATA AS TO COMPARABLE COMPENSATION FOR SIMILARLY QUALIFIED PERSONS, AND WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT AND CONTEMPORANEOUS RECORDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, AND POLICIES ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.
